appearance: Detached, slate-like surface layers, e.g. due to cross cutting; usually not easy to identify since the surface is flawless; a "skin" can often be pulled off when the surface is scratched with a blade. The molded part exhibits bubbling after warm storage.
cause:
1.High shear stress result in the formation of layers;even in compatible multiphase systems.
2.Contamination with an incompatible thermoplastic or master batch.
correction:
1.Increase melt temperature & reduce injection speed.
2.Avoid contamination due to extraneous material or due to an unsuitable master batch (specifically the carrier).
